value: <l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">30</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Now we note the beauty of the words.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">But often it is a suspended, derelict beauty. Chaos 
            <choice>
              <sic>inter</sic>
              <corr>intervenes</corr>
            </choice></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">
            <choice>
              <sic>venes</sic>
              <corr>intervenes</corr>
            </choice>. The 
            <choice>
              <sic>rl ation</sic>
              <corr>relation</corr>
            </choice> of part to part is outraged.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The balance is imperfect. Here is profusion; there bareness.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The 
            <choice>
              <sic>anony ous</sic>
              <corr>anonymous</corr>
            </choice> playwright is irresponsible. He cares nothing</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">has no conscieince about truth; he cares only for the plot.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">We are left in the end without an end. The emotion is e</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">wasted.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">But 
            <choice>
              <sic>graudally</sic>
              <corr>gradually</corr>
            </choice> the mist withdraws. So many 
            <choice>
              <sic>playwrgihts</sic>
              <corr>playwrights</corr>
            </choice></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">are 
            <choice>
              <sic>explroing</sic>
              <corr>exploring</corr>
            </choice> So many private people are pressing up</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">their weight of 
            <choice>
              <sic>unepxpressed</sic>
              <corr>unexpressed</corr>
            </choice> emotion upon the writers</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">
            <choice>
              <sic>conscious ess</sic>
              <corr>consciousness</corr>
            </choice>. Country squires are finding 
            <choice>
              <sic>themsleves</sic>
              <corr>themselves</corr>
            </choice> able</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">to say what they think without quoting <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-espe">Spenser</rs>.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The 
            <choice>
              <sic>curatin</sic>
              <corr>curtain</corr>
            </choice> rises 
            <choice>
              <sic>incesaantly</sic>
              <corr>incessantly</corr>
            </choice> upon play after play.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><add>Every Each time, with [illeg.] it rises upon a more complex, <del hand="ms">highly</del> matured drama.</add></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">After it has risen again and again it rises finally upon</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">upon the completely embodied; and upon the completely</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">controlled. It rises upon <rs type="literary-work" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#lit-haml" key="Hamlet">Hamlet</rs> and <rs type="literary-work" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#lit-ancl" key="Antony and Cleopatra">
            <choice>
              <sic>Cleoptara</sic>
              <corr>Cleopatra</corr>
            </choice></rs> and <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-fals" key="Falstaff">
              <choice>
                <sic>Flastaff</sic>
                <corr>Falstaff</corr>
              </choice></rs></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">and <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#lit-macb" key="Macbeth">Macbeth</rs>. Finally it rises upon <rs type="literary-work" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#lit-temp" key="Tempest, The">the Tempest</rs>. But the play</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">has outgrown the uncovered theatre where the sun beats and</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the rain pours. The theatre must be replaced</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">by the theatre of the brain. <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-anon" key="Anon">Anon</rs> is replaced by the man</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">who writes a book. The audience is replaced by the the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">reader. <add hand="ms" place="inline">Anon, <del hand="ms">when</del> is dead.</add></l>
